{{Day}}

==Events==
*[[1294]] &ndash; [[Pope Celestine V|Saint Celestine V]] [[papal resignation|resigns]] the [[Pope|papacy]] after only five months; Celestine hoped to return to his previous life as an [[Asceticism|ascetic]] [[hermit]].
*[[1545]] &ndash; The [[Council of Trent]] begins.
*[[1577]] &ndash; Sir [[Francis Drake]] sets sail from [[Plymouth]], [[England]], on his round-the-world voyage.
*[[1636]] &ndash; The [[Massachusetts Bay Colony]] organizes three [[militia]] regiments to defend the colony against the [[Pequot people|Pequot]] [[Native Americans in the United States|Indians]]. This organization is recognized today as the founding of the [[National Guard of the United States]].
*[[1642]] &ndash; [[Abel Tasman]] reaches [[New Zealand]].
*[[1643]] &ndash; [[English Civil War]]: The [[Battle of Alton]] takes place in [[Hampshire]].
*[[1758]] &ndash; The English transport ship ''[[Duke William (ship)|Duke William]]'' sinks in the North Atlantic, [[List of maritime disasters#Pre World War I|killing over 360 people]].
*[[1769]] &ndash; [[Dartmouth College]] is founded by the Reverend [[Eleazar Wheelock]], with a [[royal charter]] from King [[George III of the United Kingdom|George III]], on land donated by [[Governor-General#British colonialism and the Governors-General|Royal governor]] [[Sir John Wentworth, 1st Baronet|John Wentworth]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: At the [[Battle of Fredericksburg]], [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] General [[Robert E. Lee]] defeats [[Union Army|Union]] Major General [[Ambrose Burnside]].
*[[1867]] &ndash; A [[Fenian]] bomb explodes in [[Clerkenwell]], [[London|London, England]], killing six.
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[Second Sino-Japanese War]]: [[Battle of Nanking]] &ndash; The city of [[Nanjing]], defended by the [[National Revolutionary Army]] under the command of General [[Tang Shengzhi]], falls to the [[Empire of Japan|Japanese]]. This is followed by the [[Nanking Massacre]], in which Japanese troops rape and murder hundreds of thousands of civilians.
*[[1938]] &ndash; [[The Holocaust]]: The [[Neuengamme concentration camp]] opens in the [[Bergedorf]] district of [[Hamburg]], [[Germany]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Battle of the River Plate]] &ndash; Captain [[Hans Langsdorff]] of the [[Nazi Germany|German]] [[Deutschland class cruiser]] (pocket battleship) ''[[German cruiser Admiral Graf Spee|Admiral Graf Spee]]'' engages with [[Royal Navy]] cruisers {{HMS|Exeter|68|6}}, {{HMS|Ajax|22|6}} and {{HMNZS|Achilles|70|6}}.
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Kingdom of Hungary]] and [[Kingdom of Romania]] declare war on the [[United States]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Massacre of Kalavryta]] by German occupying forces in Greece.
*[[1949]] &ndash; The [[Knesset]] votes to move the capital of [[Israel]] to [[Jerusalem]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[List of archbishops of Cyprus|Archbishop]] [[Makarios III]] becomes the first [[President of Cyprus]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; While [[Emperor of Ethiopia|Emperor]] [[Haile Selassie I]] of [[Ethiopia]] visits [[Brazil]], his [[Kebur Zabagna|Imperial Bodyguard]] [[1960 Ethiopian coup attempt|seizes the capital]] and proclaims him deposed and his son, Crown Prince [[Amha Selassie|Asfa Wossen]], Emperor.
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[NASA]] launches ''[[Relay program#Relay 1|Relay 1]]'', the first active repeater communications [[satellite]] in orbit.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Constantine II of Greece]] attempts an unsuccessful [[Greek military junta of 1967–1974#The King's counter-coup|counter-coup]] against the [[Greek military junta of 1967–1974|Regime of the Colonels]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; Brazilian [[President of Brazil|President]] [[Artur da Costa e Silva]] issues [[AI-5]] (Institutional Act No. 5), enabling government by decree and suspending [[habeas corpus]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Apollo program]]: [[Eugene Cernan]] and [[Harrison Schmitt]] begin the third and final [[extra-vehicular activity]] (EVA) or "Moonwalk" of ''[[Apollo 17]]''. To date they are the last humans to set foot on the Moon.
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Malta]] becomes a republic within the [[Commonwealth of Nations]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; A [[Douglas DC-3|DC-3]] aircraft chartered from the [[Indianapolis|Indianapolis, Indiana]]-based [[Cobham Aviation Services Australia|National Jet]] crashes near [[Evansville Regional Airport]], killing 29, including the [[University of Evansville]] basketball team, support staff and boosters of the team.
*[[1979]] &ndash; The [[Politics of Canada|Canadian Government]] of [[Prime Minister of Canada|Prime Minister]] [[Joe Clark]] is defeated in the [[House of Commons of Canada|House of Commons]], prompting the [[Canadian federal election, 1980|1980 Canadian election]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; General [[Wojciech Jaruzelski]] declares [[martial law]] in [[Poland]] to prevent dismantling of the communist system by ''[[Solidarity (Polish trade union)|Solidarity]]''.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[Arrow Air Flight 1285]] crashes in [[Gander, Newfoundland and Labrador]], killing all 256 passengers and crew.
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Chairman of the Palestine Liberation Organization|PLO Chairman]] [[Yasser Arafat]] gives a speech at a [[United Nations General Assembly|UN General Assembly]] meeting in [[Geneva]], [[Switzerland]], after United States authorities refused to grant him a [[Visa (document)|visa]] to visit UN headquarters in New York.
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[The Troubles]]: [[Attack on Derryard checkpoint]] &ndash; The [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] launches an attack on a [[British Army]] temporary vehicle checkpoint near [[Rosslea|Rosslea, Northern Ireland]]. Two British soldiers are killed and one badly wounded.
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Taylor Swift]] was born
*[[2000]] &ndash; The "[[Texas Seven]]" escape from the [[John B. Connally Unit]] near [[Kenedy, Texas]], and go on a robbery spree, during which police officer Aubrey Hawkins is shot and killed.
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Sansad Bhavan]], the building housing the [[Parliament of India|Indian Parliament]], [[2001 Indian Parliament attack|is attacked by terrorists]]. Twelve people are killed, including the terrorists.
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[2004 enlargement of the European Union|European Union enlargement]]: The EU announces that [[Cyprus]], the [[Czech Republic]], [[Estonia]], [[Hungary]], [[Latvia]], [[Lithuania]], [[Malta]], [[Poland]], [[Slovakia]], and [[Slovenia]] will become members from May 1, 2004.
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Iraq War]]: [[Operation Red Dawn]] &ndash; Former [[President of Iraq|Iraqi President]] [[Saddam Hussein]] is captured near his home town of [[Tikrit]].
*[[2011]] &ndash; A [[2011 Liège attack|murder-suicide]] in [[Liège]], [[Belgium]], kills six and wounds 125 people at a [[Christmas market]].
